revised_title: A Study of Daphnia's Reproductive Methods and Ephippium Structure
tldr: The author investigates the two methods of reproduction in Daphnia and describes the structure of the ephippium. The study reveals the process of egg development and the role of germinal vesicles, granules, and oil-globules in the formation of ephippial eggs. The author also discusses the anatomy of the ovary and the receptacle, as well as the differences in reproductive processes between Daphnia species.
